quizzes.title: JavaScript Basics Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript syntax, history, and purpose.

quizzes.title: Python Basics Quiz
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge of Python programming concepts, syntax, and features.

questions.explanation: JavaScript was created by Brendan Eich in 1995 while he was working at Netscape Communications Corporation.
JavaScript was initially called 'Mocha', then renamed to 'LiveScript', and finally to 'JavaScript'.

questions.text: What is the correct syntax for a JavaScript comment?
questions.explanation: JavaScript supports both single-line comments with // and multi-line comments with /* */.

questions.text: Which of the following doesn't exist in JavasScript?
questions.explanation: Java is another programming language, while React.js, Node.js, and Next.js are JavaScript frameworks and libraries.

questions.text: JavaScript is primarily a server-side programming language.
questions.explanation: JavaScript was originally designed as a client-side scripting language for web browsers, though it is now used on servers with Node.js as well.

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of JavaScript?
options: To add interactivity to web pages
To define the structure of web pages
questions.correctAnswer: To add interactivity to web pages
questions.explanation: JavaScript was created to add interactive elements to web pages, allowing for dynamic content updates without page reloads.
The == operator in JavaScript performs type coercion, so it considers the number 5 and the string '5' to be equal.
Python was created by Guido van Rossum and first released in 1991.

questions.text: What is the correct way to create a function in Python?
questions.explanation: In Python, functions are defined using the 'def' keyword followed by the function name and parentheses.

questions.text: Python is a statically typed language.
questions.explanation: Python is dynamically typed, meaning variable types are determined at runtime, not at compile time.

questions.text:
What is the output of this code?

x = [1, 2, 3]
y = x
y.append(4)
print(x)
questions.explanation: In Python, assignment creates a reference to the same object. When we modify y, we are also modifying x because they refer to the same list.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a built-in data type in Python?
questions.explanation: Array is not a built-in data type in Python. Python uses lists instead, though arrays are available through the NumPy library.

questions.text:
What does the following code return?

def func(x, y=[]):
    y.append(x)
    return y

print(func(1))
print(func(2))
questions.explanation: In Python, default parameter values are evaluated only once when the function is defined, not each time the function is called. So the list y persists between function calls.
In Python, indentation is required and used to define code blocks. Improper indentation will result in IndentationError.
